SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.ibm.team.repository.common.query
Interface IDataField

public interface IDataField

Data fields represent descriptions of the columnar data returned from data queries. A list of data fields describes the general shape of a row of data in a data query result. A data field has a name and a type, both provided at runtime by the query service, as part of the data query result.

The name is a string representing the field in the projection clause of the query. This provides name based retrieval of field values, as defined in IDataRow. For example, suppose the following query is executed:

select t.name, count(m.item_id) from Team t, in(t.members) m group by t.name

The shape of a row in the result is comprised of two fields. The first field will be named "t.name" and the second field will be named "count(m.item_id)". Currently aliasing in the projection clause of EJB-QL is not supported and thus literal mappings are used to derive the names.

The field type is an enumerated value, defined in the constants in IDataTypes.

Since:
0.5

Method Summary
 int getFieldType()
          The enumarated literal that represents one of the supported query data types in the system.
 java.lang.String getName()
          The name of the data field.
 

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
The name of the data field. The name is provided by the query service. It represents the literal string defined in the projection clause of the query. Can be used for string based access in IDataRow get&ast methods.

Returns:
string identifying the name of the field

getFieldType

int getFieldType()
The enumarated literal that represents one of the supported query data types in the system. Valid values are defined as integer constants on IDataTypes.

Returns:
the literal corresponding to the field type
